answerText: Lewis dot structures[10] If a species cannot be represented by a single Lewis dot structure, it can be thought of as a hybrid of two or more of these kinds of structures. Two-headed arrows are placed between them.
heading: ICCS |2014 | 10 | 15 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: These drawings represent shared electrons involved in bonds as line segments.  [10] Name these two-dimensional constructs, used to visualize the bond structures of molecules, which show lone pairs of electrons as dots.
